title: CHE6030N02 Fire and Explosion Prevention | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Gain a comprehensive understanding of gas explosions, including their causes and properties.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Gain a comprehensive understanding of gas explosions, including their causes and properties.
This module has an updated learning pathway that can now be stacked towards a Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations.
It is essential for fire safety and risk management personnel to understand the principles of fires and explosions in order to determine how fires start and spread, and how explosions occur.
Basic knowledge of hazardous area classification is also vital to enabling proper selection and installation of equipment to be used safely in hazardous environments.

In this 2-day Process Safety workshop on Fire and Explosion Prevention, learners will acquire comprehensive knowledge on the causes and properties of explosions, with an emphasis on those involving gases.

The workshop will explore how mechanical and system failures lead to major accidents, provide insights into fire detection, alarm systems, and safety procedures, and explain the importance of classifying hazardous areas, materials, and temperature ranges. Additionally, learners will understand equipment protection strategies to enhance safety in hazardous environments.
Managers, engineers, operators, safety advisors and risk management practitioners
"It was good as it provided many additional safety design standards that I was not familiar."
How to carry out hazardous classification
Consequences of poor hazardous area zone classification
Types of explosion protection and prevention methods for electrical equipment
ATEX guidelines: equipment markings and enclosure types
Fire and gas detection systems engineering
Associate Professor/ Director, Professional Officers, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/ Director, Professional Officers, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Lim Kok Hwa is an Associate Professor and Director, Professional Officers Division (POD) at Singapore Institute of Technology. Over the past decade, he has taught a variety of courses, including Industrial Chemical Processes, and Industrial Chemical and Biological Plant Safety. He is also experienced in emergency/contingency planning, and is involved in many committees dealing with safety matters and safety reviews.  He received a Bachelor of Science (First Class Honours) in Computational Science and Chemistry, and a Master of Science in Chemical Engineering from the National University of Singapore. He later obtained his doctoral degree from the Technische Universität München (TUM) in Germany.

Thia Cheong Meng received his Master of Technology (Knowledge Engineering) from the National University of Singapore (Institute of System Science) and a Bachelor of Science (Chemical Engineering) from the University of Singapore.

Cheong Meng is a Principal Risk Consultant with more than 35 years of experience in process safety and risk consultancy in the petrochemical industry. He has worked for several major companies in the areas of engineering and operations with responsibilities in process engineering design, HDPE plant construction, commissioning and operation, production of metal finishing products, and management of poison chemicals.

Additionally, he has played a pivotal role in conducting process safety studies, encompassing activities like Quantitative Risk Assessment (QRA), Hazard and Operability Studies (HAZOP), Safety Integrity Level (SIL) Classification and Verification, and Fire and Gas Detectors Mapping. His proficiency extends to tasks such as safety case preparation, audits, and the development of reliability diagrams. He has also contributed to roadmap studies for digitising process safety information systems and conducted user requirements analysis for real-time emergency response systems utilised by industrial chemical complexes.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit-bearing assessment during the module; and
Submit a written portfolio within one month of the module
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
Participants who successfully obtain all 8 Certificate of Attainment in the Process Safety Operations series will receive a Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations.
The full fee for this course is S$1,744.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
This is a Union Training Assistance Programme (UTAP) supported course.
When applying for this course, in the "Remarks" field, please:
Inform us if you are a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer (WSHO) to claim SDUs
Provide your PE registration number if you are a Professional Engineer to claim PDUs

Earn a Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations

The Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations is designed to help individuals, who are tasked with safety responsibilities, gain the engineering and management expertise to operate a plant safely.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Embracing Singapore’s new safety case regime

With the regulations for Safety Case Regime kicking in from September 2017, all Major Hazards Installation (MHI) companies will be required to submit a Safety Case to demonstrate how risks from major accident hazards can be reduced to as low as reasonably practicable (ALARP).
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Graduate Certificate in Fire Dynamics and Fire Modelling
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
CHE6031N01 Process Safety Management and KPIs
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
Next-Generation Food Innovation: Texture Development and Advanced Rheology
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
CHE6031N02 Permit to Work for Management
This course delves into the operations and compliance measures of the Permit to Work (PTW) system, enhancing control over high-risk tasks and ensuring workplace safety.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design
This course covers RAM theory and its application across industries to assess system performance and efficiency, thereby enhancing system availability.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Management and Engineering Design

arrow--right
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.

With the regulations for Safety Case Regime kicking in from September 2017, all Major Hazards Installation (MHI) companies will be required to submit a Safety Case to demonstrate how risks from major accident hazards can be reduced to as low as reasonably practicable (ALARP).
Explore the fundamentals of fire engineering science and its role in analysing fire behaviour, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics in complex built environments.
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Learn about effective Process Safety Management systems and associated performance measurement to ensure safe plant operations.
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
This course delves into the operations and compliance measures of the Permit to Work (PTW) system, enhancing control over high-risk tasks and ensuring workplace safety.
This course covers RAM theory and its application across industries to assess system performance and efficiency, thereby enhancing system availability.
